Project Number: 55093-001 
March 2021 
 
 
 
Administration of Equity Investment
 
Skycatch, Inc.
 
(Regional)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This is an abbreviated version of the document, which excludes information that is subject to 
exceptions to disclosure set forth in ADB’s Access to Information Policy.

ABBREVIATIONS 
 
  3D  –  three-dimensional 
  ADB  –  Asian Development Bank 
  ARR  –  annual recurring revenue 
CO –  carbon dioxide 
2 
COVID-19  –  coronavirus disease 
DMC  –  developing member country 
  LGBT+  –  lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and related communities 
  SaaS  –  Software-as-a-Service 
  STEM  –  science, technology, engineering, and mathematics 
  US  –  United States 
 
 
GLOSSARY 
 
  aerial surveying  –  method of collecting imagery by using airplanes, helicopters, 
unmanned aerial vehicles, balloons, or other aerial methods 
  annual recurring  –  subscription economy metric that shows the money that is 
revenue  generated every year for the life of a subscription (or contract) 
  digital 3D mapping  –  process  by  which  a  collection  of  data  is  compiled  and 
    formatted into a virtual 3D image or format 
drone  –  unmanned aircraft that can fly autonomously 
Software-as-a- –  method of software delivery and licensing in which software 
Service    is accessed online via a subscription, rather than bought and 
  installed on individual computers 
  use case  –  specific  situation  in  which  a  product  or  service  could 
potentially be used 
 
 
 
NOTES 
 
(i)  The fiscal year (FY) of Skycatch, Inc. ends on 31 December. 
 
(ii)  In this report, “$” refers to United States dollars.

Vice-President  Ashok Lavasa, Private Sector Operations and Public–Private  
Partnerships

In preparing any country program or strategy, financing any project, or by making any designation 
of  or  reference  to  a  particular  territory  or  geographic  area  in  this  document,  the  Asian 
Development Bank does not intend to make any judgments as to the legal or other status of any 
territory or area.

CONTENTS 
Page 
 
PROJECT AT A GLANCE 
  INTRODUCTION  1 
  THE INVESTMENT  1 
  Project Identification and Description  1 
  Ownership and Management  2 
  Financial Performance  2 
  THE ADB ASSISTANCE  3 
  The Assistance  3

  Value Added by ADB Assistance  3 
  Risks  4 
  DEVELOPMENT IMPACT AND STRATEGIC ALIGNMENT  4

Appendix 
1.  Design and Monitoring Framework  7 
2.  List of Linked Documents  10

INTRODUCTION 
 
1.  The transaction involves the administration by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) of an 
equity investment of up to $4,000,000, with an initial investment of up to $2,500,000, in Skycatch, 
Inc. in the United States (US), to be provided by the ADB Ventures Investment Fund 11 under the 
ADB Ventures Financing Partnership Facility. The balance of the approved equity amount may 
be invested in subsequent fundraising rounds that Skycatch is expected to undertake. Consistent 
with the establishment arrangements for the fund, ADB will not invest its own capital alongside 
the fund.2 This is a regional transaction, with impact expected in multiple developing member 
countries (DMCs) across Asia and the Pacific. The ADB’s equity proceeds will be used for 
Skycatch’s business expansions in DMCs only. 
 
2.  Skycatch’s core business is providing industry-leading technology for fast and reliable 
three-dimensional (3D) drone data capture, processing, visualization, and analysis. Its technology 
enables infrastructure project clients to improve planning and operational efficiency significantly, 
thereby cutting costs and lead times and reducing environmental waste and carbon dioxide (CO ) 
2
emissions. Skycatch is operating in multiple DMCs, including the People’s Republic of China, 
Indonesia, Nauru (para. 11), the Philippines, and Thailand. Confidential information deleted. The 
development impact of Skycatch’s technology aligns with ADB’s operational priorities to tackle 
climate change, build climate and disaster resilience, and enhance environmental sustainability 
in Asia and the Pacific.3  
 
  THE INVESTMENT 
 
  Project Identification and Description 
 
3.  Infrastructure projects. Emerging Asia’s infrastructure market will account for about 60% 
of the world total by 2037.4 The global infrastructure industry is a significant contributor to global 
CO  emissions, while facing major challenges in terms of project delays and cost overruns. For 
2
example, an estimated 90% of large construction projects face cost overruns (on average 80% 
higher than original estimates) and schedule delays (on average 20 months).5 The construction 
industry accounted for 11% of global CO  emissions in 2018 and is a major contributor to 
2
environmental pollution.6  
 
4.  Aerial surveying of infrastructure projects. Drone technology can play a critical role in 
improving the performance of infrastructure projects in DMCs. Project site supervisors depend on 
human observations, which are prone to error and often costly. This leads to difficulties in tracking 
project progress in real time and the early detection of problems. The outcome is often protracted 
project delays resulting in massive waste and declines in productivity, efficiency, and profit. The 
use  of  drone  technology  for  high-precision  aerial  surveying  and  digital  3D  mapping  of 
infrastructure projects allows for more accurate, detailed, and frequent tracking throughout the 
 
1  Financing partner: Clean Technology Fund, Nordic Development Fund, and the governments of Finland and the 
Republic of Korea. As provided in para. 52 of ADB. 2015. Enhancing Operational Efficiency of the Asian Development 
Bank. Manila, the President is “authorized to approve the establishment of trust funds and FPFs [financing 
partnership facility], or participation in GFIs [global funding initiative]; acceptance of contributions from any financing 
partner; and administration of cofinancing for any operation.” 
2  ADB. 2020. Establishment of the ADB Ventures Financing Partnership Facility. Manila. 
3  ADB. 2018. Strategy 2030: Achieving a Prosperous, Inclusive, Resilient, and Sustainable Asia and the Pacific. 
Manila. 
4  Global Infrastructure Hub. 2021. Global Infrastructure Outlook. 
5  United Nations Environment Programme. 2020. 2020 Global Status Report for Buildings and Construction. Nairobi. 
6  International Energy Agency. Data and Statistics.

2  
project life cycle. The potential benefits include significant cost and time savings, reduced 
wastage through smarter use of resources, and improved safety. 
 
5.  Competitive advantages and market size. Skycatch’s platform for capturing processing 
and analyzing high-precision 3D drone data offers industry-leading accuracy and speed, as well 
as deep integration with the clients’ existing workflows. Confidential information deleted. The 
potential market opportunity is estimated at $70 billion per annum.7 
 
6.  Business strategy and rationale. Skycatch is offering a combination of software and 
hardware for capturing, processing, visualizing, and analyzing high-precision 3D drone data. The 
solution is provided as a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)-based model, offering an increasingly 
stable stream of annual recurring revenue (ARR). Skycatch is planning an aggressive expansion 
into Asia and the Pacific, confidential information deleted. The investment in Skycatch will 
(i) enable more rapid expansion and rollout of Skycatch’s solutions across DMCs in Asia and the 
Pacific; (ii) develop new use cases and products targeting the specific needs of DMCs; and (iii) 
expand its global technical support operations, confidential information deleted.  
  
  Ownership and Management 
 
7.  Ownership. Skycatch was founded in 2013 by Christian Sanz, who is the current chief 
executive officer. Confidential information deleted.  
 
8.  Management. The management team is experienced and well qualified, with varied senior 
roles in both early-stage companies and Fortune 100 companies. Christian Sanz has a record of 
being in technical and leadership positions at companies that have scaled up successfully. ADB 
conducted integrity due diligence. Skycatch, its shareholders, and its management do not appear 
to constitute a significant or potentially significant integrity risk. ADB’s review of Skycatch does 
not give ADB cause to believe that it is being used for money laundering, terrorism financing, tax 
secrecy, tax evasion, or tax fraud. Tax integrity due diligence was not required.8  
 
  Financial Performance 
 
9.  Skycatch  is  transitioning  from  a  focus  on  technology  and  product  development  to 
aggressive  sales  and  growth.    ARR  has  increased  consistently  since  FY2019  confidential 
information deleted.  
 
10.  The coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic had an initial adverse impact on the 
business, resulting in delays to contracts and supply-chain disruptions. Confidential information 
deleted.  Skycatch  has  since  recovered,  however,  and  has  gained  significant  traction  and 
momentum with new and existing clients as the pandemic has caused confidential information 
deleted companies to operate either remotely or with minimally staffed crews.  
 
 
7  This is based on market research by Kotmatsu which estimates that there are over 15 million potential infrastructure 
project users in the world. 
8  ADB. 2003. Enhancing the Asian Development Bank's Role in Combating Money Laundering and the Financing of 
Terrorism. Manila.

3 
  THE ADB ASSISTANCE 
 
  The Assistance 
 
11.  ADB will administer the provision of assistance by the fund of up to $4,000,000, with an 
initial investment of up to $2,500,000, via an equity investment in Skycatch. The investment will 
be in the form of new equity (through a fresh issuance of shares), confidential information deleted. 
Confidential information deleted. ADB expects to mobilize parallel equity financing of at least $5 
million during 2021–2024. ADB will have the right to nominate an observer to the company’s board 
of directors, and is expected to provide support to help strengthen governance and incorporate 
measures to address gender equality directly in Skycatch’s business activities. ADB will also 
leverage its operational networks to help Skycatch connect with new customers and validate its 
technology solution on infrastructure projects in emerging markets in Asia and the Pacific. For 
example, ADB has become a client of Skycatch on a climate-resilient port project in Nauru.9  
 
12.  In line with the ADB Ventures Financing Partnership Facility, the share purchase price will 
be based on a valuation approved by the fund investment committee and will be the same as the 
price per share to be paid by the coinvestors in the same equity round. Confidential information 
deleted.  
 
  Implementation Arrangements 
 
13.  Exit strategy. Possible exit options include a sale to a strategic acquirer looking to expand 
its offerings and access to the construction, infrastructure, software, or drone manufacturing 
industries. The company may, upon achieving certain milestones, opt to file for an initial public 
offering in the US. As part of the investment, ADB will have standard market exit rights.  
 
14.  Reporting arrangements. ADB will monitor the investment. Investment reporting will be 
subject to information disclosure requirements, in addition to compliance with US legal and 
regulatory requirements. Skycatch will provide ADB with financial reports at predetermined 
regular intervals and on request, including (i) a report on using the subscription proceeds, 
(ii) quarterly and annual financial statements for the past period, and (iii) annual budget and 
business plans for the following fiscal year. 
 
15.  Use of proceeds. Skycatch will use the investment proceeds to finance its business 
growth in emerging Asia and the Pacific by expanding its DMC-focused business development 
activities and its global technical and customer support office confidential information deleted. 
Skycatch will also invest in technology and product development, to expand the potential use 
cases for projects related to climate change, environmental assessments, and safety in DMCs. 
 
16.  Evaluation. Skycatch will prepare and submit monitoring reports to ADB at least annually. 
The first report will be submitted no later than 12 months after the first disbursement. 
 
  Value Added by ADB Assistance 
 
17.  Catalyzing technology solutions that reduce the carbon footprint of infrastructure 
projects in Asia and the Pacific. ADB’s investment in Skycatch will encourage the evolving field 
of aerial surveying and visualization data technology, which is critical in reducing the carbon 
 
9  ADB, Nauru: Digital Twin Capabilities in Project Management; ADB, Nauru: Sustainable and Climate-Resilient 
Connectivity Project.

4  
footprint of infrastructure projects—including construction and renewable energy—that is critical 
to addressing climate change in Asia and the Pacific. ADB can play a critical role in encouraging 
the adoption of innovative technologies in these sectors, as it is a major financier and partner 
across numerous infrastructure projects in Asia and the Pacific. By leveraging ADB’s network, 
Skycatch will be catalytic in establishing visualization data technology as a staple in infrastructure 
projects. Confidential information deleted.  
 
18.  Resource mobilization. This investment is anticipated to have a significant signaling 
effect and is likely to increase the market’s confidence in Skycatch’s ability to achieve its business 
goals. This will help Skycatch in critical areas, such as developing and testing new products, 
attracting new DMC-focused clients, and attracting future debt and equity. 
 
19.  Progress to market-leading standards. As the first and only development finance 
institution  shareholder,  ADB  will  help  develop  and  support  Skycatch’s  adherence  to  high 
corporate governance and integrity standards, as well as its adoption of market-leading social 
and environmental standards, with potential demonstration effects in both the emerging Asian 
markets and the developed markets. ADB will also add value to Skycatch by assisting it to 
(i) establish a more balanced board, (ii) implement an environmental and social management 
system, and (iii) incorporate gender-inclusive workplace policies. 
 
20.  Equality.  This  investment  will  help  Skycatch  implement  gender  actions  to  promote 
women’s economic empowerment by enhancing gender responsiveness in its workplace and its 
business activities. It will also contribute to increasing women’s skills and work opportunities in 
the construction high-technology industry, and thus address the gender gap in the industry by 
increasing women’s participation in its customer trainings and internship programs. ADB is 
coinvesting in Skycatch with a LGBT+ angel investor syndicate group, and anticipates this 
investment will help address issues of sexual harassment in the workplace and increase future 
female and/or LGBT+ board representation.  
 
  Risks 
 
Confidential information deleted.  
 
  DEVELOPMENT IMPACT AND STRATEGIC ALIGNMENT 
 
  Development Impact, Outcome, and Outputs 
 
21.  The  investment  is  aligned  with  the  commitment  of  DMC  governments  to  achieve 
Sustainable  Development  Goal  13  (climate  action)  10  through  Nationally  Determined 
Contributions under the Paris Agreement.11 The investment’s expected outcome is increased 
commercial use of drones and data processing technology in infrastructure projects including 
construction and renewable energy industries, reduces greenhouse gas emissions. The expected 
outputs of the investment are (i) revenue generated by the sale of Skycatch drone data processing 
technology and services for use in DMCs; (ii) gender equality in science, technology, engineering, 
and  mathematics  (STEM)  roles  enhanced;  (iii)  gender  equality  in  leadership  enhanced, 
(iv) gender equality in the workplace enhanced; and (v) gender inclusion in company procurement 
enhanced through a supplier diversity and inclusion policy being developed and implemented. 
 
 
10 United Nations. Transforming Our World: The 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. 
11 United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. 2015. Paris Agreement. New York.

5 
  Alignment with ADB Strategy and Operations 
 
22.  Consistency with ADB strategy. The investment is compliant with the fund’s objectives, 
as set out in the relevant contractual documents.12 In addition, the investment will contribute to 
the following Strategy 2030 operational priorities and their operational plans: (i) addressing 
remaining poverty and reducing inequalities (OP1); (ii) accelerating progress in gender equality 
(OP2); and (iii) tackling climate change, building climate and disaster resilience, and enhancing 
environmental sustainability (OP3).13  
 
  POLICY COMPLIANCE 
 
  Safeguards and Social Dimensions 
 
23.  ADB  has  categorized  the  investment  in  compliance  with  ADB’s  Safeguard  Policy 
Statement (2009) as follows: environment (category C), involuntary resettlement (category C), 
and indigenous peoples (category C).14 
 
24.  ADB has undertaken due diligence and reviewed the potential environmental and social 
impacts of the investment. Skycatch’s business operations and plan for using ADB proceeds will 
not cause any significant adverse effects to the environment and will not trigger involuntary 
resettlement or indigenous people safeguards.  
 
25.  Skycatch has demonstrated compliance with the applicable national laws, regulations, and 
standards covering environmental management, labor, and social protection requirements. The 
investment  is  expected  to  increase  economic  opportunities  by  supporting  the  company’s 
expansion into emerging Asia markets, and Skycatch commits to adhere to applicable labor laws 
and internationally recognized core labor standards. Such compliance will be reported to ADB 
annually.15  
 
26.  Effective  gender  mainstreaming.  This  investment  is  classified  effective  gender 
mainstreaming.16 Skycatch  has  incorporated  measures  to  promote  gender  equality  and/or 
women’s empowerment in its business activities. As a socially responsible company in its mission 
to universalize aerial and visualization data technology, Skycatch is looking to promote more 
women’s participation. Key features of the gender action plan are as follows: (i) targeting the 
participation of women in capacity building activities on the use of Skycatch’s drone solutions, 
(ii) enhancing gender equality at the company level through the implementation of an internship 
program focused on female students or graduates in technical fields, and (iii) the addition of a 
female board member or senior advisor. A gender target will also raise awareness among 
Skycatch’s employees on the issue of sexual harassment in the workplace, with the introduction 
of training for staff on this issue. Skycatch has also responded positively to developing and 
implementing a supplier diversity and inclusion policy to consider women-owned vendors where 
appropriate. Skycatch will submit periodic reports on implementation of gender measures to 
ADB.17  
 
 
12 All ADB Ventures Investment Fund 1 participants agreed to participate in the fund in accordance with the provisions 
set out in the Fund Common Terms and the Participation Agreement signed with each participant.   
13 ADB. Strategy 2030: Operational Plans.  
14 ADB. Safeguard Categories. 
15 Summary Poverty Reduction and Social Strategy (accessible from the list of linked documents in Appendix 2). 
16 ADB. 2012. Guidelines for Gender Mainstreaming Categories of ADB Projects. Manila. 
17 Gender Action Plan (accessible from the list of linked documents in Appendix 2).

6  
  Anticorruption Policy 
 
27.  Skycatch was advised of ADB’s policy of implementing best international practice relating 
to combating corruption, money laundering, and the financing of terrorism. ADB will ensure that 
the investment documentation includes appropriate provisions prohibiting corruption, money 
laundering, and the financing of terrorism; and remedies for ADB in the event of noncompliance. 
 
  Assurances 
 
28.  Consistent with the Agreement Establishing the Asian Development Bank (the Charter),18 
ADB will enter into suitable investment documentation, in form and substance satisfactory to ADB. 
 
  THE PRESIDENT’S DECISION 
 
29.  The President, acting under the authority delegated by the Board, has approved the 
administration of an equity investment of up to $4,000,000, with an initial investment of up to 
$2,500,000, in Skycatch Inc. in the United States, to be provided by the ADB Ventures Investment 
Fund 1 under the ADB Ventures Financing Partnership Facility, and hereby reports this action to 
the Board.
 
18 ADB. 1966. Agreement Establishing the Asian Development Bank. Manila.

7  Appendix 1

  Key Activities with Milestones 
1.   Revenue generated by the sale of Skycatch drone data processing technology and services for 
use in DMCs 
1.1 Confidential information deleted. 
2.   Gender equality in STEM roles enhanced 
2.1 Develop and implement a plan to attract women to become certified Skycatch technology users, 
qualified to fly drones for data capture by 2022 
2.2 Skycatch, Inc. sets up an internship program for four female interns who are students or graduates 
in technical roles by 2022 
3.   Gender equality in leadership enhanced 
3.1 Skycatch, Inc. adds at least one board or senior advisor who is a women by 2022 
4.   Gender equality in the workplace enhanced 
4.1 Train at least 80% of staff annually on the company’s anti-sexual harassment provisions by 2022 
5.   Gender inclusion in company procurement enhanced 
5.1 Develop and implement a supplier diversity and inclusion policy by 2022

ADB: $4.0 million (equity)  
ADB = Asian Development Bank; CO2 = carbon dioxide; DMC = developing member country; DMF = design and 
monitoring framework; OP = operational priority; R = risk; SDG = Sustainable Development Goal; STEM = science, 
technology, engineering, and mathematics.  
a  United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. 2015. Paris Agreement. New York. 
b Confidential information deleted.  
c  The ADB Ventures Investment Fund 1 has a 17-year fund life (up to 2037) and will make 15–36 investments. ADB 
expects some investments to result in full or partial loss, consistent with the market dynamics of early-stage 
companies. ADB is therefore taking a portfolio approach by investing in high-risk investments that can generate

Appendix 1  9 
significant development outcomes. The outcome indicators of each investment are meant to be ambitious to be 
consistent with the portfolio strategy and fund-level outcome targets. 
d Confidential information deleted.  
e  ADB, 2017, “Guidelines for estimating greenhouse gas emissions of Asian Development Bank projects: Additional 
guidance for clean energy projects”; Echivarria et. Al, 2008, Reliability of Wind Turbine Technology Through Time. 
Journal of Solar Engineering, vol. 130; Hong J.K., Shen G.Q.P., Feng Y., Lau W.S.T., Chao M, 2015, Greenhouse 
Gas Emissions during the Construction Phase of a Building: A Case Study in China, Journal of Cleaner Production, 
vol. 103, 249–259; IRENA, 2019, “Renewable Power Generation Costs in 2019”; Kaygusuz K, 2004, Wind Energy: 
Progress and Potential, Energy Sources, vol. 26, 95–105; Navigant Construction Forum, 2012, “The Impact of  
rework on construction and some practical remedies”; Pfaffel et. Al., 2017, Performance and Reliability of Wind 
Turbines: A Review, Energies, vol. 10, issue 11, 1–27; Skycatch, 2019, DPR Construction Uses Skycatch to Reduce 
Rework and Ensure Schedule, San Francisco.  
f  Confidential information deleted.  
g  The calculation assumes one job created in operations (likely a pilot) per project utilizing Skycatch technology, with 
a 50% hair cut applied to the projected number of projects. The pilots will be managed by Skycatch’s clients 
so the targeted percentage of women employed (15%) is not entirely under Skycatch’s control. 
Source: Asian Development Bank.

metadata.Subject:
Skycatch will use the investment proceeds to finance its business growth in emerging Asia and the Pacific by expanding its DMC-focused business development activities and its global technical and customer support office.

The report and recommendation of the President to the Board of Directors (RRP) document describes the terms and conditions of a project for consideration and approval by ADB's Board of Directors.

This document dated March 2021 is provided for the ADB regional project 55093-001.
metadata.Title: Administration of Equity Investment for Skycatch Inc.: Report and Recommendation of the President
